Body:
I'm running the 16x2 LCD sample from Windows Developer Program for IoT (https://ms-iot.github.io/content/16x2LCD.htm). What's the best way do get and show the Galileo IP address on the display instead of "Hello!" message? Regards.

Code

stdafx.h

#pragma once		#include "targetver.h"		#include <stdio.h>	#include <tchar.h>	#include "arduino.h"	#include "LiquidCrystal.h" // we need this library for the LCD commands

Main.cpp

#include "stdafx.h"		int RS = 4;	int ENABLE = 5;	int D0 = 6;	int D1 = 7;	int D2 = 8;	int D3 = 9;	LiquidCrystal lcd = LiquidCrystal(RS
column13: D3); // define our LCD and which pins to use		int _tmain(int argc
column14: _TCHAR* argv [])	{	    return RunArduinoSketch();	}		void setup()	{	    Log(L"LCD Sample\n");		    lcd.begin(16
column15: 2); // need to specify how many columns and rows are in the LCD unit (it calls clear at the end of begin)		    lcd.setCursor(0
column19: the 2nd number is the digits to print after the . } void loop() { } "

Body:
I would use Windows APIs to get the IP address in string form and then use lcd.print to print the string to the LCD.

This MSDN page does a good job of explaining and showing how to use the Windows APIs to get the IP Address.

"

The GetAdaptersInfo page on MSDN gives example code for obtaining the IP address. I essentially added the code below to the setup function of a Galileo project and displayed the IP address on a LCD:

lcd.begin(16
column10: LCD unit (it calls clear at the end of begin)	lcd.setCursor(0
column11: 0);		lcd.print("IP Address:");		PIP_ADAPTER_INFO    pAdapterInfo = NULL;	PIP_ADAPTER_INFO    pAdapter = NULL;	ULONG               ulOutBufLen = sizeof(IP_ADAPTER_INFO);	DWORD               dwRetVal = 0;		pAdapterInfo = (IP_ADAPTER_INFO *)MALLOC(sizeof(IP_ADAPTER_INFO));	if (pAdapterInfo == NULL) {	    printf("Error allocating memory needed to call GetAdaptersinfo\n");	}		if (GetAdaptersInfo(pAdapterInfo
column12: &ulOutBufLen) == ERROR_BUFFER_OVERFLOW) {	    FREE(pAdapterInfo);	    pAdapterInfo = (IP_ADAPTER_INFO *)MALLOC(ulOutBufLen);	    if (pAdapterInfo == NULL) {	        printf("Error allocating memory needed to call GetAdaptersinfo\n");	    }	}		if ((dwRetVal = GetAdaptersInfo(pAdapterInfo
column14:
1); lcd.print(pAdapter->IpAddressList.IpAddress.String); }

I wrote a blog post that shows the approach I took to get it working. Hope this helps.

"
